Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:68: He said: Lo! they are my guests. Affront me not!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:69: And keep your duty to Allah, and shame me not!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:70: They said; Have we not forbidden you from (entertaining) anyone ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:71: He said: Here are my daughters, if ye must be doing (so).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:72: By thy life (O Muhammad) they moved blindly in the frenzy of approaching death.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:73: Then the (Awful) Cry overtook them at the sunrise.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:74: And We utterly confounded them, and We rained upon them stones of heated clay.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:75: Lo! therein verily are portents for those who read the signs.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:76: And lo! it is upon a road still uneffaced.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:77: Lo! therein is indeed a portent for believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:78: And the dwellers in the wood indeed were evil-doers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:79: So we took vengeance on them; and lo! they both are on a high-road plain to see.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:80: And the dwellers in Al-Hijr denied (Our) messengers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:81: And we gave them Our revelations, but they were averse to them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:82: And they used to hew out dwellings from the hills, (wherein they dwelt) secure.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:83: But the (Awful) Cry overtook them at the morning hour,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:84: And that which they were wont to count as gain availed them not.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:85: We created not the heavens and the earth and all that is between them save with truth, and lo! the Hour is surely coming. So forgive, (O Muhammad), with a gracious forgiveness.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:86: Lo! Thy Lord! He is the All-Wise Creator.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:87: We have given thee seven of the oft-repeated (verses) and the great Qur’an.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:88: Strain not thine eyes toward that which We cause some wedded pairs among them to enjoin, and be not grieved on their account, and lower thy wing (in tenderness) for the believers.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:89: And say: Lo! I, even I, am a plain warner,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:90: Such as We send down for those who make division,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:91: Those who break the Qur’an into parts.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:92: Them, by thy Lord, We shall question, every one,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:93: Of what they used to do.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:94: So proclaim that which thou art commanded, and withdraw from the idolaters.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:95: Lo! We defend thee from the scoffers,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:96: Who set some other god along with Allah. But they will come to know.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:97: Well know We that thy bosom is oppressed by what they say,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:98: But hymn the praise of thy Lord, and be of those who make prostration (unto Him).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 15:99: And serve thy Lord till the Inevitable cometh unto thee.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:1: A. L. R. These are the Ayats of Revelation,- of a Qur’an that makes things clear.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:2: Again and again will those who disbelieve, wish that they had bowed (to God’s will) in Islam.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:3: Leave them alone, to enjoy (the good things of this life) and to please themselves: let (false) hope amuse them: soon will knowledge (undeceive them).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:4: Never did We destroy a population that had not a term decreed and assigned beforehand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:5: Neither can a people anticipate its term, nor delay it.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:6: They say: "O thou to whom the Message is being revealed! truly thou art mad (or possessed)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:7: "Why bringest thou not angels to us if it be that thou hast the Truth?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:8: We send not the angels down except for just cause: if they came (to the ungodly), behold! no respite would they have!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:9: We have, without doubt, sent down the Message; and We will assuredly guard it (from corruption).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:10: We did send apostles before thee amongst the religious sects of old:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:11: But never came an apostle to them but they mocked him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:12: Even so do we let it creep into the hearts of the sinners -
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:13: That they should not believe in the (Message); but the ways of the ancients have passed away.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:14: Even if We opened out to them a gate from heaven, and they were to continue (all day) ascending therein,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:15: They would only say: "Our eyes have been intoxicated: Nay, we have been bewitched by sorcery."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:16: It is We Who have set out the zodiacal signs in the heavens, and made them fair-seeming to (all) beholders;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:17: And (moreover) We have guarded them from every evil spirit accursed:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:18: But any that gains a hearing by stealth, is pursued by a flaming fire, bright (to see).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:19: And the earth We have spread out (like a carpet); set thereon mountains firm and immovable; and produced therein all kinds of things in due balance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:20: And We have provided therein means of subsistence,- for you and for those for whose sustenance ye are not responsible.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:21: And there is not a thing but its (sources and) treasures (inexhaustible) are with Us; but We only send down thereof in due and ascertainable measures.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:22: And We send the fecundating winds, then cause the rain to descend from the sky, therewith providing you with water (in abundance), though ye are not the guardians of its stores.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:23: And verily, it is We Who give life, and Who give death: it is We Who remain inheritors (after all else passes away).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:24: To Us are known those of you who hasten forward, and those who lag behind.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:25: Assuredly it is thy Lord Who will gather them together: for He is perfect in Wisdom and Knowledge.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:26: We created man from sounding clay, from mud moulded into shape;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:27: And the Jinn race, We had created before, from the fire of a scorching wind.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:28: Behold! thy Lord said to the angels: "I am about to create man, from sounding clay from mud moulded into shape;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:29: "When I have fashioned him (in due proportion) and breathed into him of My spirit, fall ye down in obeisance unto him."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:30: So the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:31: Not so Iblis: he refused to be among those who prostrated themselves.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:32: (God) said: "O Iblis! what is your reason for not being among those who prostrated themselves?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:33: (Iblis) said: "I am not one to prostrate myself to man, whom Thou didst create from sounding clay, from mud moulded into shape."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:34: (God) said: "Then get thee out from here; for thou art rejected, accursed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:35: "And the curse shall be on thee till the day of Judgment."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:36: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! give me then respite till the Day the (dead) are raised."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:38: "Till the Day of the Time appointed."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:39: (Iblis) said: "O my Lord! because Thou hast put me in the wrong, I will make (wrong) fair-seeming to them on the earth, and I will put them all in the wrong,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:40: "Except Thy servants among them, sincere and purified (by Thy Grace)."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:41: (God) said: "This (way of My sincere servants) is indeed a way that leads straight to Me.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:42: "For over My servants no authority shalt thou have, except such as put themselves in the wrong and follow thee."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:43: And verily, Hell is the promised abode for them all!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:44: To it are seven gates: for each of those gates is a (special) class (of sinners) assigned.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:45: The righteous (will be) amid gardens and fountains (of clear-flowing water).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:46: (Their greeting will be): "Enter ye here in peace and security."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:47: And We shall remove from their hearts any lurking sense of injury: (they will be) brothers (joyfully) facing each other on thrones (of dignity).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:48: There no sense of fatigue shall touch them, nor shall they (ever) be asked to leave.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:49: Tell My servants that I am indeed the Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:50: And that My Penalty will be indeed the most grievous Penalty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:51: Tell them about the guests of Abraham.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:52: When they entered his presence and said, "Peace!" He said, "We feel afraid of you!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:53: They said: "Fear not! We give thee glad tidings of a son endowed with wisdom."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:54: He said: "Do ye give me glad tidings that old age has seized me? Of what, then, is your good news?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:55: They said: "We give thee glad tidings in truth: be not then in despair!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:56: He said: "And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, but such as go astray?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:57: Abraham said: "What then is the business on which ye (have come), O ye messengers (of God)?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:58: They said: "We have been sent to a people (deep) in sin,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:59: "Excepting the adherents of Lut: them we are certainly (charged) to save (from harm),- All -
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:60: "Except his wife, who, We have ascertained, will be among those who will lag behind."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:61: At length when the messengers arrived among the adherents of Lut,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:62: He said: "Ye appear to be uncommon folk."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:63: They said: "Yea, we have come to thee to accomplish that of which they doubt.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:64: "We have brought to thee that which is inevitably due, and assuredly we tell the truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:65: "Then travel by night with thy household, when a portion of the night (yet remains), and do thou bring up the rear: let no one amongst you look back, but pass on whither ye are ordered."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:66: And We made known this decree to him, that the last remnants of those (sinners) should be cut off by the morning.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:67: The inhabitants of the city came in (mad) joy (at news of the young men).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:68: Lut said: "These are my guests: disgrace me not:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:69: "But fear God, and shame me not."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:70: They said: "Did we not forbid thee (to speak) for all and sundry?"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:71: He said: "There are my daughters (to marry), if ye must act (so)."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:72: Verily, by thy life (O Prophet), in their wild intoxication, they wander in distraction, to and fro.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:73: But the (mighty) Blast overtook them before morning,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:74: And We turned (the cities) upside down, and rained down on them brimstones hard as baked clay.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:75: Behold! in this are Signs for those who by tokens do understand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:76: And the (cities were) right on the high-road.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:77: Behold! in this is a sign for those who believed.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:78: And the Companions of the Wood were also wrong-doers;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:79: So We exacted retribution from them. They were both on an open highway, plain to see.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:80: The Companions of the Rocky Tract also rejected the apostles:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:81: We sent them Our Sings, but they persisted in turning away from them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:82: Out of the mountains did they hew (their) edifices, (feeling themselves) secure.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:83: But the (mighty) Blast seized them of a morning,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:84: And of no avail to them was all that they did (with such art and care)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:85: We created not the heavens, the earth, and all between them, but for just ends. And the Hour is surely coming (when this will be manifest). So overlook (any human faults) with gracious forgiveness.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:86: For verily it is thy Lord who is the Master-Creator, knowing all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:87: And We have bestowed upon thee the Seven Oft-repeated (verses) and the Grand Qur’an.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:88: Strain not thine eyes. (Wistfully) at what We have bestowed on certain classes of them, nor grieve over them: but lower thy wing (in gentleness) to the believers.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:89: And say: "I am indeed he that warneth openly and without ambiguity,"-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:90: (Of just such wrath) as We sent down on those who divided (Scripture into arbitrary parts),-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:91: (So also on such) as have made Qur’an into shreds (as they please).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:92: Therefore, by the Lord, We will, of a surety, call them to account,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:94: Therefore expound openly what thou art commanded, and turn away from those who join false gods with God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:95: For sufficient are We unto thee against those who scoff,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:96: Those who adopt, with God, another god: but soon will they come to know.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:97: We do indeed know how thy heart is distressed at what they say.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:98: But celebrate the praises of thy Lord, and be of those who prostrate themselves in adoration.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 15:99: And serve thy Lord until there come unto thee the Hour that is Certain.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:1: Alif Lam Ra. Those are the signs of the Book and of a manifest Koran.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:2: Perchance the unbelievers will wish that they had surrendered:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:3: leave them to eat, and to take their joy, and to be bemused by hope; certainly they will soon know!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:4: Never a city have We destroyed, but it had a known decree,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:5: and no nation outstrips its term, nor do they put it back.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:6: They say: ’Thou, upon whom the Remembrance is sent down, thou art assuredly possessed!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:7: Why dost thou not bring the angels unto us, if thou speakest truly?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:8: We send not down the angels, save with truth;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:9: then they would not be respited. It is We who have sent down the Remembrance, and We watch over it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:10: Indeed, We sent Messengers before thee, among the factions of the ancients,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:11: and not a single Messenger came to them, but they mocked at him;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:12: even so We cause it to enter into the hearts of the sinners --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:13: they believe not in it, though the wont of the ancients is already gone.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:14: Though We opened to them a gate in heaven, and still they mounted through it,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:15: yet would they say, ’Our eyes have been dazzled; nay, we are a people bewitched!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:16: We have set in heaven constellations and decked them out fair to the beholders,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:17: and guarded them from every accursed Satan
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:18: excepting such as listens by stealth -- and he is pursued by a manifest flame.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:19: And the earth -- We stretched it forth, and cast on it firm mountains, and We caused to grow therein of every thing justly weighed,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:20: and there appointed for you livelihood, and for those you provide not for.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:21: Naught is there, but its treasuries are with Us, and We send it not down but in a known measure.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:22: And We loose the winds fertilising, and We send down out of heaven water, then We give it to you to drink, and you are not its treasurers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:23: It is We who give life, and make to die, and it is We who are the inheritors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:24: We know the ones of you who press forward, and We know the laggards;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:25: and it is thy Lord shall muster them, and He is All-wise, All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:26: Surely We created man of a clay of mud moulded,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:27: and the jinn created We before of fire flaming.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:28: And when thy Lord said to the angels, ’See, I am creating a mortal of a clay of mud moulded.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:29: When I have shaped him, and breathed My spirit in him, fall you down, bowing before him!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:30: Then the angels bowed themselves all together,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:31: save Iblis; he refused to be among those bowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:32: Said He, ’What ails thee, Iblis, that thou art not among those bowing?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:33: Said he, ’I would never bow myself before a mortal whom Thou hast created of a clay of mud moulded.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:34: Said He, ’Then go thou forth hence; thou art accursed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:35: Upon thee shall rest the curse, till the Day of Doom.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:36: Said he, ’My Lord, respite me till the day they shall be raised.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:37: Said He, ’Thou art among the ones that are respited
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:38: unto the day of a known time.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:39: Said he, ’My Lord, for Thy perverting me I shall deck all fair to them in the earth, and I shall pervert them, all together,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:40: excepting those Thy servants among them that are devoted.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:41: Said He, ’This is for Me a straight path:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:42: over My servants thou shalt have no authority, except those that follow thee,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:43: being perverse; Gehenna shall be their promised land all together.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:44: Seven gates it has, and unto each gate a set portion of them belongs.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:45: But the godfearing shall be amidst gardens and fountains:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:46: ’Enter you them, in peace and security!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:47: We shall strip away all rancour that is in their breasts; as brothers they shall be upon couches set face to face;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:48: no fatigue there shall smite them, neither shall they ever be driven forth from there.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:49: Tell My servants I am the All-forgiving, the All-compassionate,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:50: and that My chastisement is the painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:51: And tell them of the guests of Abraham,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:52: when they entered unto him, saying, ’Peace!’ He said, ’Behold, we are afraid of you.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:53: They said, ’Be not afraid; behold, we give thee good tidings of a cunning boy.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:54: He said, ’What, do you give me good tidings, though old age has smitten me? Of what do you
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:55: give me good tidings?’ They said, ’We give thee good tidings of truth. Be not of those that despair.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:56: He said, ’And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, excepting those that are astray?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:57: He said, ’And what is your business, envoys?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:58: They said, ’We have been sent unto a people of sinners,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:59: excepting the folk of Lot; them we shall deliver
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:60: all together, excepting his wife -- we have decreed, she shall surely be of those that tarry.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:61: So, when the envoys came to the folk of Lot,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:62: he said, ’Surely you are a people unknown to me!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:63: They said, ’Nay, but we have brought thee that concerning which they were doubting.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:64: We have come to thee with the truth, and assuredly we speak truly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:65: So set forth, thou with thy family, in a watch of the night, and follow after the backs of them, and let not any one of you turn round; and depart unto the place you are commanded.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:66: And We decreed for him that commandment, that the last remnant of those should be cut off in the morning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:67: And the people of the city came rejoicing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:68: He said, ’These are my guests; put me not to shame,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:69: and fear God, and do not degrade me.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:70: They said, ’Have we not forbidden thee all beings?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:71: He said, ’These are my daughters, if you would be doing.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:72: By thy life, they wandered blindly in their dazzlement,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:73: and the Cry seized them at the sunrise,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:74: and We turned it uppermost nethermost and rained on it stones of baked clay.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:75: Surely in that are signs for such as mark;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:76: surely it is on a way yet remaining;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:77: surely in that is a sign for believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:78: Certainly the dwellers in the Thicket were evildoers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:79: and We took vengeance on them. The two of them were upon a roadway manifest.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:80: The dwellers in El-Hijr cried lies to the Envoys.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:81: We brought them. Our signs, and they turned away from them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:82: They were hewing the mountains into houses, therein dwelling securely;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:83: and the Cry seized them in the morning;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:84: that they earned did not avail them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:85: We created not the heavens and the earth, and all that is between them, save in truth. Surely the Hour is coming; so pardon thou, with a gracious pardoning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:86: Surely thy Lord, He is the All-creator, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:87: We have given thee seven of the oft-repeated, and the mighty Koran.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:88: Stretch not thine eyes to that We have given pairs of them to enjoy; and do not sorrow for them, and lower thy wing unto the believers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:89: and say, ’Surely, I am the manifest warner.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:90: So We sent it down to the partitioners,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:91: who have broken the Koran into fragments.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:92: Now by thy Lord, We shall surely question them all together
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:94: So shout that thou art commanded and turn thou away from the idolaters.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:95: We suffice thee against the mockers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:96: even against those who set up with God another god. Certainly they will soon know!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:97: We know indeed thy breast is straitened by the things they say.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:98: Proclaim thy Lord’s praise, and be of those that bow,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 15:99: and serve thy Lord, until the Certain comes to thee.

Muhammad Asad.verse 15:1: Alif. Lām. Rā. THESE ARE MESSAGES of revelation – of a discourse clear in itself and clearly showing the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:2: And it will come to pass that those who are [now] bent on denying this truth will wish that they had surrendered themselves to God [in their lifetime].
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:3: Leave them alone; let them eat and enjoy themselves the while the hope [of vain delights] beguiles them: for in time they will come to know [the truth].
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:4: And never have We destroyed any community [for its wrongdoing] unless a divine writ had [previously] been made known to it;
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:5: [but remember that] no community can ever forestall [the end of] its term – and neither can they delay .
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:6: And yet, they [who deny the truth] say: "O thou unto whom this reminder has [allegedly] been bestowed from on high: verily, thou art mad!
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:7: Why dost thou not bring before us angels, if thou art a man of truth?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:8: [Yet] We never send down angels otherwise than in accordance with the [demands of] truth; and [were the angels to appear now,] lo! they [who reject this divine writ] would have no further respite!
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:9: Behold, it is We Ourselves who have bestowed from on high, step by step, this reminder: and, behold, it is We who shall truly guard it [from all corruption].
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:10: AND, INDEED, [O Prophet,] even before thy time did We send [Our apostles] unto communities of old
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:11: and never yet came an apostle to them without their deriding him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:12: Even so do We [now] cause this [scorn of Our message] to pervade the hearts of those who are lost in sin,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:13: who do not believe in it, although the way which those [evildoers] of olden times had to go has long been within their ken.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:14: Yet even had We opened to them a gateway to heaven and they had ascended, on and on, up to it,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:15: they would surely have said, "It is only our eyes that are spellbound! Nay, we have been bewitched!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:16: AND, INDEED, We have set up in the heavens great constellations, and endowed them with beauty for all to behold;
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:17: and We have made them secure against every satanic force accursed
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:18: so that anyone who seeks to learn [the unknowable] by stealth is pursued by a flame clear to see.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:19: And the earth – We have spread it out wide, and placed on it mountains firm, and caused [life] of every kind to grow on it in a balanced manner,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:20: and provided thereon means of livelihood for you [O men] as well as for all [living beings] whose sustenance does not depend on you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:21: For no single thing exists that does not have its source with Us; and nought do We bestow from on high unless it be in accordance with a measure well-defined.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:22: And We let loose the winds to fertilize [plants], and We send down water from the skies and let you drink thereof: and it is not you who dispose of its source
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:23: for, behold, it is We – We alone – who grant life and deal death, and it is We alone who shall remain after all else will have passed away!
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:24: And well do We know [the hearts and deeds of all human beings – both] those who lived before you and those who will come after you;
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:25: and, behold, it is thy Sustainer who will gather them all together [on Judgment Day]: verily, He is wise, all-knowing!
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:26: AND, INDEED, We have created man out of sounding clay, out of dark slime transmuted
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:27: whereas the invisible beings We had created, [long] before that, out of the fire of scorching winds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:28: And lo! Thy Sustainer said unto the angels: "Behold, I am about to create mortal man out of sounding clay, out of dark slime transmuted;
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:29: and when I have formed him fully and breathed into him of My spirit, fall down before him in prostration!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:30: Thereupon the angels prostrated themselves, all of them together,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:31: save Iblīs: he refused to be among those who prostrated themselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:32: Said He: "O Iblīs! What is thy reason for not being among those who have prostrated themselves?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:33: [Iblīs] replied: "It is not for me to prostrate myself before mortal man whom Thou hast created out of sounding clay, out of dark slime transmuted!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:34: Said He: "Go forth, then, from this [angelic state]: for, behold, thou art [henceforth] accursed,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:35: and [My] rejection shall be thy due until the Day of Judgment!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:36: Said [Iblīs]: "Then, O my Sustainer, grant me a respite till the Day when all shall be raised from the dead!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:37: Answered He: "Verily, so be it: thou shalt be among those who are granted respite
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:38: till the Day the time whereof is known [to Me alone]."
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:39: [Whereupon Iblīs] said: "O my Sustainer! Since Thou hast thwarted me, I shall indeed make [all that is evil] on earth seem goodly to them, and shall most certainly beguile them into grievous error
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:40: [all] save such of them as are truly Thy servants!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:41: Said He: "This is, with Me, a straight way:
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:42: verily, thou shalt have no power over My creatures – unless it be such as are [already] lost in grievous error and follow thee [of their own will]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:43: and for all such, behold, hell is the promised goal,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:44: with seven gates leading into it, each gate receiving its allotted share of sinners."
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:45: VERILY, those who are conscious of God [shall find themselves in the hereafter] amidst gardens and springs,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:46: [having been received with the greeting,] "Enter here in peace, secure!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:47: And [by then] We shall have removed whatever unworthy thoughts or feelings may have been [lingering] in their breasts, [and they shall rest] as brethren, facing one another [in love] upon thrones of happiness.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:48: No weariness shall ever touch them in this [state of bliss], and never shall they have to forgo it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:49: Tell My servants that I – I alone – am truly forgiving, a true dispenser of grace;
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:50: and [also,] that the suffering which I shall impose [on sinners] will indeed be a suffering most grievous.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:51: AND TELL THEM [once again] about Abraham’s guests
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:52: [how,] when they presented themselves before him and bade him peace, he answered: "Behold, we are afraid of you!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:53: Said they: "Fear not! Behold, we bring thee the glad tiding of [the birth of] a son who will be endowed with deep knowledge."
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:54: Said he: "Do you give me this glad tiding despite the fact that old age has overtaken me? Of what [strange thing], then, are you giving me a tiding!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:55: They answered: "We have given thee the glad tiding of something that is bound to come true: so be not of those who abandon hope!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:56: [Abraham] exclaimed: "And who – other than those who have utterly lost their way – could ever abandon the hope of his Sustainer’s grace?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:57: He added: "And what [else] may you have in view, O you [heavenly] messengers?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:58: They answered: "We are sent to people lost in sin [who are to be destroyed],
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:59: barring Lot’s household, all of whom, behold, we shall save
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:60: excepting only his wife, [of whom God says,] ‘We have ordained [that], behold, she should be among those who stay behind!’"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:61: AND WHEN the messengers [of God] came to the house of Lot,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:62: he said: "Behold, you are people unknown !"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:63: They answered: "Nay, but we have come unto thee with [the announcement of] something that they [who are given to evil] have always been wont to call in question,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:64: and we are bringing thee the certainty [of its fulfilment]: for, behold, we are speaking the truth indeed.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:65: Go, then, with thy household while it is yet night, with thyself following them in the rear; and let none of you look back, but proceed whither you are bidden."
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:66: And [through Our messengers] We revealed unto him this decree: "The last remnant of those [sinners] shall be wiped out in the morn."
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:67: And the people of the city came [unto Lot], rejoicing at the glad tiding.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:68: Exclaimed [Lot]: "Behold, these are my guests: so put me not to shame,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:69: but be conscious of God and disgrace me not!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:70: They answered: "Have we not forbidden thee [to offer protection] to any kind of people?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:71: [Lot] said: "[Take instead] these daughters of mine, if you must do [whatever you intend to do]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:72: [But the angels spoke thus:] "As thou livest, [O Lot, they will not listen to thee:] behold, in their delirium [of lust] they are but blindly stumbling to and fro!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:73: And thereupon the blast [of Our punishment] overtook them at the time of sunrise,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:74: and We turned those [sinful towns] upside down, and rained down upon them stone-hard blows of chastisement pre-ordained.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:75: Verily, in all this there are messages indeed for those who can read the signs:
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:76: for, behold, those [towns] stood by a road that still exists.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:77: Verily, herein lies a message indeed for all who believe [in God].
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:78: AND THE DWELLERS of the wooded dales [of Madyan, too,] were inveterate evildoers,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:79: and so We inflicted Our retribution on them. And, behold, both these [sinful communities] lived by a highway, [to this day] plain to see.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:80: AND, [likewise,] indeed, the people of Al-Hijr gave the lie to [Our] message-bearers:
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:81: for We did vouchsafe them Our messages, but they obstinately turned their backs upon them
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:82: notwithstanding that they had been wont [to enjoy Our blessings and] to hew out dwellings from the mountains, [wherein they could live] in security
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:83: and so the blast [of Our punishment] overtook them at early morn,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:84: and of no avail to them was all [the power] that they had acquired.
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:85: AND [remember:] We have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them without [an inner] truth; but, behold, the Hour [when this will become clear to all] is indeed yet to come. Hence, forgive [men’s failings] with fair forbearance:
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:86: verily, thy Sustainer is the all-knowing Creator of all things!
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:87: AND, INDEED, We have bestowed upon thee seven of the oft-repeated [verses], and [have, thus, laid open before thee] this sublime Qur’ān:
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:88: [so] turn not thine eyes [longingly] towards the worldly benefits which We have granted unto some of those [that deny the truth]. And neither grieve over those [who refuse to heed thee], but spread the wings of thy tenderness over the believers,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:89: and say: "Behold, I am indeed the plain warner [promised by God]!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:90: [For thou art the bearer of a divine writ] such as We have bestowed from on high upon those who [afterwards] broke it up into parts,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:91: [and] who [now] declare this Qur’ān to be [a tissue of] falsehoods!
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:92: But, by thy Sustainer! [On the Day of Judgment] We shall indeed call them to account, one and all,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:94: Hence, proclaim openly all that thou hast been bidden [to say], and leave alone all those who ascribe divinity to aught beside God:
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:95: verily, We shall suffice thee against all who [now] deride [this message – all]
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:96: who assert that there are, side by side with God, other divine powers as well: for in time they will come to know [the truth].
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:97: And well do We know that thy bosom is constricted by the [blasphemous] things that they say:
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:98: but extol thou thy Sustainer’s limitless glory and praise Him, and be of those who prostrate themselves [before Him] in adoration,
Muhammad Asad.verse 15:99: and worship thy Sustainer till death comes to thee.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:1: Alif, Lām, Rā. These are verses of the Book and the enlightening Qur’ān.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:2: On many occasions, the disbelievers will wish that they were Muslims.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:3: Let them eat and enjoy, and let (their) fancy make them neglectful, for they shall soon come to know (their ultimate end).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:4: We did not destroy any town without having a pre-determined time for it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:5: No people can precede their appointed time, nor can they exceed it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:6: They say, “O you to whom the Dhikr (the Qur’ān) has been revealed, you are surely insane.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:7: Why do you not bring the angels to us, if you are one of the truthful?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:8: We do not send down the angels except with truth, and then they shall be given no respite.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:9: We, Ourselves, have sent down the Dhikr (the Qur’ān), and We are there to protect it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:10: We did send the messengers before you among the groups of earlier peoples.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:11: No messenger came to them but they used to mock at him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:12: Likewise, We make it (i.e. disbelief) enter into the hearts of the sinners,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:13: (whereby) they do not believe in it (the Qur’ān), and this has been the way of earlier people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:14: Even if We open a gate in the sky and they keep ascending through it,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:15: still they will say, “In fact our eyes have been deluded; rather we are enchanted people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:16: We have created stellar formations in the sky and have beautified them for onlookers,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:17: and have protected them from every outcast devil,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:18: but the one who tries to eavesdrop is chased by a clearly visible flame.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:19: As for the earth, We have stretched it out and placed on it firm mountains, and We have caused to grow in it everything well-balanced,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:20: and created in it sources of sustenance for you and those (creatures) for whom you are not the sustainers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:21: We have treasures of every thing, but We send it down only in a determined quantity.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:22: And We sent forth winds carrying the clouds, then sent down water from the sky and gave it to you to drink, and you are not able to store it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:23: It is indeed We, and only We, who give life and bring death, and We are the ultimate inheritor (of everything).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:24: We know those of you who went ahead, and We know those who remained late.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:25: Surely, your Lord will gather all of them together. Indeed He is All-Wise, All-Knowing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:26: Indeed We created man from a ringing clay made of decayed mud.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:27: As for the Jānn (the first Jinn), We had created him earlier from the fire of the scorching wind.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:28: Recall when your Lord said to the angels, “I am going to create a human being from a ringing clay made of decayed mud.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:29: When I form him perfect, and blow in him of My spirit, then you must fall down before him in prostration.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:30: So the angels prostrated themselves, all together,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:31: except Iblīs (Satan). He refused to join those who prostrated.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:32: He (Allah) said, “O Iblīs, what is the matter with you that you did not join those who prostrated?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:33: He said, “I am not such that I should prostrate myself before a mortal whom You have created from a ringing clay made of decayed mud.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:34: He said, “Then, get out of here, for you are an outcast,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:35: and upon you is the curse up to the Day of Judgment.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:36: He said, “My Lord, then give me respite up to the day they (the dead) shall be raised.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:37: He (Allah) said, “Well, respite is given to you
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:38: till the day of the Appointed Time.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:39: He said, “My Lord, since You made me go astray, I swear that I shall beautify for them (evils) on the earth, and shall lead all of them astray,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:40: except those of Your servants from among them who are chosen (by You).”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:41: He (Allah) said, “This is the straight path leading to Me (that a person is chosen by Me through his good deeds).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:42: My servants are such that you have no power over them except those of the deviators who will follow you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:43: And Jahannam (Hell) is the promised place for them all.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:44: It has seven gates. For each gate there is a group apportioned from them.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:45: Surely, the God-fearing will be in gardens and streams:
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:46: “Enter here in peace, free of fear.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:47: We shall have removed whatever grudge they had in their hearts, (thus making them) brothers, sitting on couches, face to face.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:48: No weariness shall touch them nor will they be expelled from there.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:49: Tell My servants that I am the Most-Forgiving, the Very-Merciful
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:50: and that My punishment is the painful punishment,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:51: and tell them about the guests of Ibrāhīm.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:52: When they visited him, they greeted him with Salām (peace on you). He said, “We are scared of you.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:53: They said, “Do not be scared. We give you good news of a boy who will be knowledgeable.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:54: He said, “Do you give me the good news despite the old age has befallen me? So what good news you are giving to me?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:55: They said, “We have given to you the good news of a fact. So do not be one of those who lose hope.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:56: He said, “Who can lose hope in the mercy of his Lord except those who have lost the straight path?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:57: He said, “Then, what is your mission, O messengers?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:58: They said, “We have been sent to a sinful people,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:59: except the family of LūT - all of whom we shall save,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:60: but his wife. We have ordained that she will be among those who will remain behind.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:61: So when the messengers came to the family of LūT,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:62: he said, “You are an unfamiliar people.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:63: They said, “No, but we have brought to you that (scourge) in which they have been doubting,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:64: and we have come to you with a definite matter and surely we are truthful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:65: So, carry your family after a part of the night (has passed), and follow them at the rear (to make sure that all of your family has joined you), and no one from you should look back; and keep going to where you are commanded.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:66: We conveyed to him Our decision that they (the unbelievers) were to be totally uprooted when they would see the morning.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:67: And the people of the city came rejoicing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:68: He (LūT) said, “They are my guests; so do not put me to shame,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:69: and fear Allah and do not disgrace me.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:70: They said, “Had we not forbidden you from (being the guardian of) the whole world?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:71: He said, “These are my daughters, if you are to do something.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:72: By your life, (O prophet) they were wandering blindly in their intoxication (misguidance).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:73: So, they were seized by the Cry at sunrise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:74: Then, We turned it (the city) upside down and rained down upon them stones of baked clay.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:75: Surely, in that there are signs for those who read signs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:76: Surely, it (their city) is located on the straight road.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:77: Surely, in it there is a sign for the believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:78: And the people of Aikah were (also) transgressors.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:79: So, We punished them in retribution, and both of them are (situated) by a highway, clearly visible.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:80: And the people of Al-Hijr gave the lie to the messengers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:81: We provided them with Our signs, yet they kept turning away from them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:82: They used to hew out houses from the hills peacefully.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:83: Then, the Cry seized them by the morning.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:84: So, whatever they earned did not come to their help.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:85: We did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is in between them without a truthful purpose. The Hour is sure to come. Therefore, overlook (their evil behavior) in a gracious manner.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:86: Surely, your Lord is the Creator of all, the All-Knowing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:87: We have given you the seven oft-repeated verses and the glorious Qur’ān.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:88: Never stretch your eyes towards what We have given to groups of them to enjoy, and do not grieve for them, and be kind to believers in humbleness,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:89: and say, “I am a plain warner indeed”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:90: (to warn them that We may send down the scourge upon them) as We sent down upon the dividers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:91: who had split the divine recitation (Scriptures) into bits.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:92: So, by your Lord, We shall question all of them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:93: about what they have been doing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:94: Now, proclaim what you are commanded to, and turn away from those who ascribe partners to Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:95: Surely, We are sufficient for you against those who deride,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:96: - those who believe in any other god along with Allah. So, they shall soon learn (the reality).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:97: We know that your heart feels distressed for what they say.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:98: So, proclaim the purity and glory of your Lord, and be among those who prostrate themselves (before Allah);
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 15:99: and worship your Lord until comes to you that which is certain.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:1: Alif lām rāʾ. Those are the verses of the Book and of a manifest Qurʾān.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:2: It may be that those who disbelieve will wish that they had been muslims.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:3: Leave them to eat and to enjoy, and that they be diverted by hope, for they will come to know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:4: And We did not destroy any town, but that it had a known decree.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:5: No community can outstrip its [predetermined] term nor can they [seek to] delay it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:6: And they say: ‘O you, to whom the Remembrance has been revealed, lo! you are indeed possessed!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:7: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you are of the truthful?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:8: The angels do not descend save with the truth; and then, they [the disbelievers] would not be reprieved.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:9: Verily it is We Who have revealed the Remembrance, and assuredly We will preserve it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:10: And verily We sent before you [messengers] to former factions.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:11: And never did a messenger come to them but that they mocked him.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:12: Thus We cause it to find its way into the hearts of the sinners.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:13: They do not believe in him, even though the example of the men of old has already gone before.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:14: And even if We were to open for them a gate from the heaven, and they were to continue ascending through it,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:15: they would say, ‘It is merely that our eyes have been dazzled. Nay, we are a folk bewitched!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:16: And verily We have placed in the heaven constellations, and We have adorned it for beholders;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:17: and We have guarded them from every outcast devil;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:18: except the one who listens by stealth — he is pursued by a clear flame.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:19: And the earth We have stretched it out, and cast therein firm mountains, and caused to grow therein every kind of balanced thing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:20: And We have made for you therein [means of] livelihood, and those for whom you do not provide.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:21: And there is not a thing but that the stores thereof are with Us, and We do not send it down except in a known measure.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:22: And We send the winds as fertilisers, and send down out of the heaven water so that We give it to you to drink, for you are not the storers thereof.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:23: Indeed it is We Who give life and bring death, and We are the heirs.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:24: And verily We know the predecessors among you, and verily We know the successors.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:25: And it is indeed your Lord Who will gather them, lo! He is the Wise, the Knower.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:26: And verily We created man out of a dry [clinking] clay of malleable mud.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:27: And the jānn We created beforehand out of the permeative fire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:28: And when your Lord said to the angels, ‘Indeed I am going to create a mortal out of a dry clay [drawn] from a malleable mud.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:29: So, when I have proportioned him and breathed of My Spirit in him, fall down in prostration before him!’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:30: And so the angels prostrated, all of them together,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:31: except Iblīs, he refused to be among those prostrating.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:32: He [said]: ‘O Iblīs what is wrong with you that you are not among those prostrating?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:33: Said he, ‘I was not about to prostrate myself before a mortal whom You have created out of a dry clay [drawn] from malleable mud’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:34: Said He, ‘Then be gone from hence; for you are indeed accursed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:35: And indeed the curse shall rest upon you until the Day of Judgement’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:36: Said he, ‘My Lord! Reprieve me until the day when they shall be resurrected’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:37: Said He, ‘Then lo! you are of those reprieved,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:38: until the day of the known time’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:39: Said he, ‘My Lord, because You have lead me astray, I shall adorn for them [evil acts] in the earth and I shall lead them astray, all of them;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:40: except those servants of Yours who are sincerely devoted [to You]’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:41: He said, ‘This is a straight path [leading] to Me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:42: Truly over My servants you shall have no warrant, except those who follow you from among the perverse.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:43: And truly Hell shall be their tryst, all of them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:44: It has seven gates — to each gate belongs an appointed portion of them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:45: Truly the God-fearing shall be amidst gardens and springs’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:47: And We remove whatever rancour may be in their breasts. As brethren, [they shall recline] upon couches, facing one another.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:48: No toil will touch them, nor will they be expelled from thence.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:49: Tell My servants that verily I am the Forgiving, the Merciful,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:50: and that My chastisement is the painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:51: And tell them of the guests of Abraham,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:52: [how] when they entered unto him, and said, ‘Peace!’ He said, ‘Lo! we are afraid of you’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:53: They said, ‘Do not be afraid; lo!, we give you good tidings of a knowledgeable boy’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:54: He said, ‘Do you give me good tidings when old age has befallen me?’ So, of what do you give me good tidings?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:55: They said, ‘We give you good tidings in truth; so do not be of the despairing’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:56: He said, ‘And who despairs of the mercy of his Lord, save those who are astray?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:57: He said, ‘So what is your business, O you who have been sent [by God]?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:58: They said, ‘We have been sent to a sinning folk,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:59: [all] except the family of Lot; indeed we shall save them, all of them,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:60: except his wife — We have decreed that she indeed should be of those who will remain behind’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:61: And when those who had been sent [by God] came to the family of Lot,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:63: They said, ‘Rather, we have come to you because of that which they used to doubt.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:64: And we have brought you the Truth and indeed we speak truthfully.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:65: So travel with your family in a portion of the night and follow their rear; and let none of you turn round, and go whither you are commanded’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:66: And We conveyed to him the matter that these [sinners] was to be eradicated by morning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:67: And then came the people of the city, rejoicing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:68: He said, ‘Lo! these are my guests, so do not disgrace me;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:69: and fear God, and do not humiliate me’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:70: They said, ‘Have we not forbidden you from [entertaining] anyone?’
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:71: He said, ‘These here are my daughters, if you must be doing ’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:72: By your life in their drunkenness they were bewildered.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:73: Then the Cry seized them at sunrise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:74: And We made their topmost part their nethermost, and We rained on them stones of baked clay.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:75: Indeed in that there are signs for those who take note.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:76: And indeed they are on a road that [still] remains.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:77: There is indeed a sign in that for believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:78: And certainly the dwellers in the wood were evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:79: So We exacted retribution from them. And certainly both of them are upon a open road.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:80: And verily the dwellers in al-Hijr denied those who had been sent [by God].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:81: And We brought them Our signs, but they were averse [to them].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:82: And they used to hew out dwellings from the mountains, feeling secure.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:83: But the Cry seized them in the morning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:84: And so that which they used to count as gain did not avail them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:85: We did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between them save with the Truth. And truly the Hour shall come. So be forgiving with gracious forgiveness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:86: Truly your Lord, He is the Creator, the Knowing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:87: And verily We have given you seven of the oft-repeated [verses] and the great Qur’ān.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:88: Do not extend your glance toward that which We have given different groups of them to enjoy, and do not grieve for them, and lower your wing for the believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:89: And say: ‘Indeed, I am the warner, the clear .
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:90: Even as We sent down on those who make division,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:91: those who have reduced the Recitation, to parts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:92: By your Lord, We shall question them all
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:93: about what they used to do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:94: So proclaim what you have been commanded, and turn away from the idolaters.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:95: Indeed We have sufficed you against the mockers,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:96: those [mockers] who set up besides God another god: soon they will know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:97: And verily We know that your breast is [at times] oppressed by what they say.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:98: So glorify the praise of your Lord, and be of those who prostrate themselves,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 15:99: and worship your Lord until Certainty comes to you.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:1: Alif, Lam, Ra. (Only Allah and the Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him] know the real meaning.) These are the Verses of the (Glorious) Book and the Enlightening Qur’an.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:2: (Watching the scenes of Allah’s mercy on the believers in the Hereafter,) the disbelievers will persistently aspire: would that they were Muslims!
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:3: (Feel not aggrieved.) Leave them. Let them eat (and drink) and make merry and let (their) false hopes keep them negligent (of the Hereafter). Then they will come to know (their end) soon.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:4: And never have We destroyed any township, except that there was for them a known inscription (law, which they violated and met their fate).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:5: No people can go beyond their appointed term, nor can they step back (under the law of rise and fall).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:6: And (the disbelievers) say (insolently): ‘O man on whom this Qur’an has been revealed, indeed you are insane.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:7: Why do you not bring us angels if you are truthful?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:8: We do not send down angels but with the (judgment of) truth (i.e., We send them down to execute the torment when its time approaches), and they are not granted respite at that time.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:9: Assuredly, We alone have revealed this Glorious Admonition (the Qur’an), and surely We alone will guard it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:10: And We indeed sent Messengers before you as well amongst the earlier generations.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:11: And there did not come to them any Messenger but they would mock him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:12: That is how We infuse this (mockery and ridicule) into the hearts of the sinners;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:13: These people will not believe in this (Qur’an), and (this) is what has been the practice of the bygone people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:14: And if We open to them some gate in the heaven (and also make this possible for them that) they keep ascending through (it) the whole day,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:15: (Even then) they will certainly say (this): ‘Our eyes have been hypnotized (through some magic trick and deceit), rather we are spellbound.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:16: And indeed, We brought into existence constellations in the heavens (in the form of galaxies to safeguard the planets), and adorned this (spatial universe) for the beholders.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:17: And We have ensured the protection of this (system of heavenly universe) from every outcast satan (i.e., from the destructive phenomenon of every rebellious force).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:18: But anyone who tries to eavesdrop, an illuminating (i.e., blazing) meteor follows it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:19: And We have spread out the earth (despite its being round), and We brought about firm mountains in it (by allying different elements together), and in it We provided means of growth to all species in (requisite) proportion.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:20: And in it We generated for you means of subsistence and also for those (human beings, animals and birds) whom you do not provide for.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:21: And there is not a thing (in the universe) but that We have its treasures with Us, and We send it down only according to a fixed quantity.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:22: And We send winds carrying the burden of clouds. Then We pour down water from the sky. Then it is you whom We give it to drink, and it is not you who maintain its reservoirs.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:23: And indeed, We alone give life and cause death, and We alone are the Inheritor (and the Owner of all).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:24: And surely, We know those who lived before you, and We also know those who will come after you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:25: Verily, it is your Lord Who will gather them together (on the Day of Resurrection). Surely, He is Most Wise, All-Knowing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:26: And indeed, We originated man’s (chemical) genesis from that dry sounding clay which, (first) having grown old (and under the heat of the sun and other chemical and biological effects), had turned into black stinking mud.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:27: And We created jinn before this from a smokeless blazing fire.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:28: And (recall) when your Lord said to the angels: ‘I am about to create a human organism from old (and) black stinking, resounding mud.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:29: So when I accomplish the perfection of his (physical) constitution into his real being, and breathe My (divine) spirit into (the inner self of) this (human physical) organism, then fall down prostrate before him.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:30: So, (no sooner did the light of Allah’s effulgence illumine the human organism than) all the angels fell down in prostration together,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:31: Except Iblis. He refused to join those who prostrated themselves.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:32: (Allah) said: ‘O Iblis, what has happened to you that you have not joined those who have prostrated themselves?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:33: (Iblis) replied: ‘I cannot be the one who should fall down prostrate before a human being You have created from old (and) black stinking, sounding mud.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:34: (Allah) said: ‘Then get out from here, for you are indeed the cursed one (the outcast).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:35: And, verily, the curse will (persistently) rest upon you till the Day of Recompense.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:36: He said: ‘O Lord, then grant me respite till the Day (when) people will be raised up (again).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:37: Allah said: ‘So, indeed, you are amongst those granted respite,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:38: Till the Day of the appointed time (Resurrection).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:39: Iblis said: ‘O Lord, because You have led me astray, I will (also) best adorn and embellish for them (the sins, revolts and violations) in the earth and will certainly lead all of them astray by all means,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:40: Except for those exalted servants of Yours who have attained freedom (from my deceits and intrigues of the ill-commanding selves).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:41: Allah said: ‘This (freedom from these deceits and intrigues) is the (very) path that leads straight to My Threshold.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:42: Surely, you will in no way be able to influence My servants (who have attained this freedom from you) except the misguided lot who have adopted your way.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:43: And verily, the promised place for all of them is Hell.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:44: It has seven doors; for each one a fixed portion of them has been specified.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:45: Indeed, the Godfearing will be amid Gardens and fountains.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:46: (It will be said to them:) ‘Enter them peacefully, casting aside all fears.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:47: And We shall remove from their breasts all spite that they had (in the world against one another due to misunderstanding). They shall be brothers seated on couches face to face (in Paradise).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:48: No discomfort will touch them, nor will they be driven out from there.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:49: (O Beloved!) Tell My servants: ‘Indeed, I am Most Forgiving, Ever-Merciful.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:50: And (also warn) that: ‘It is My torment which is the most grievous torment.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:51: And (also) relate to them the news about the guests of Ibrahim (Abraham).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:52: When they came to Ibrahim (Abraham), they greeted (him with): ‘Peace.’ Ibrahim (Abraham) said: ‘We are feeling somewhat afraid of you.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:53: (The guest angels) said: ‘Do not feel afraid. We give you the glad tidings of (the birth of) a son endowed with knowledge and wisdom.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:54: Ibrahim (Abraham) said: ‘You are giving me the glad tidings at a time when old age has already overtaken me. So what good news are you giving me now?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:55: They said: ‘We give you the good news which is true. So do not lose hope.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:56: Ibrahim (Abraham) said: ‘Who can lose hope of his Lord’s mercy except the strayed ones?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:57: Ibrahim (Abraham) asked: ‘O deputed angels (sent by Allah), what other assignment do you have (to accomplish besides these glad tidings for which you have come)?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:58: They said: ‘We have been sent towards a sinful people,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:59: Except the family of Lut (Lot) all of whom We will indeed save,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:60: With the exception of his wife. We have decided that she shall certainly be amongst those who stay back (to become the victims of the torment).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:61: Then, when those deputed (angels) came to the house of Lut (Lot),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:63: They said: ‘(No indeed;) in fact we have come to you with the (punishment) about which these people have had doubts.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:64: And we have brought you (the judgment of) the truth and we are certainly truthful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:65: So set off with your family sometime during the night, and follow them in the rear, and none of you should (even) look back, and proceed to the place (where) you have been commanded.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:66: And We informed Lut (Lot) of this judgment through Revelation that the root of these people would be cut off the moment it dawns.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:67: And the people of the city (possessed by their lust) approached (Lut [Lot]), rejoicing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:68: Lut (Lot) said: ‘Surely, they are my guests, so do not put me to shame (about them).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:69: And fear (the wrath of) Allah and do not humiliate me.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:70: Those (lost in wickedness) said: ‘(O Lut [Lot],) did we not forbid you (to provide protection to) all the people of the world?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:71: Lut (Lot) said: ‘There are my (people’s) daughters. If you desire to do something (then marry them instead of perpetrating indecency).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:72: (O Glorious Beloved!) By your (sacred) life, surely these people (too) are wandering astray, possessed by their lust (like the people of Lut [Lot]).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:73: So, the blazing blast seized them at sunrise.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:74: And We turned their town upside down and rained upon them stones of baked clay.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:75: Verily, in this (occurrence) there are signs for those who possess the ability to probe into reality.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:76: And truly that town lies along a frequented highway.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:77: Surely, in this (episode of the people of Lut [Lot]), there is a sign of (warning) for the believers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:78: And, in reality, the dwellers of al-Ayka (the Thick Wood) too were hardened wrongdoers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:79: So We avenged Ourselves on them (as well), and (archeological remains of) both these (towns still exist) on the highway.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:80: And no doubt, the people of the valley of al-Hijr (the Rock) too denied the Messengers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:81: And We (also) bestowed upon them Our signs, but they persisted in turning away from them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:82: And they used to carve out houses in the mountains without any threat and fear.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:83: And the dreadful blast seized them (as well) the moment it dawned.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:84: So (the riches) they used to earn could not repel (Allah’s punishment) from them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:85: And We have not created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them without any purpose. And the Hour of Resurrection is certainly approaching. So, (O embodiment of excellent morality,) bear with (them) most graciously and effectively with perseverance.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:86: Indeed, your Lord alone is the Creator of all things, All-Knowing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:87: And surely We have bestowed upon you the seven oft-recited Verses (i.e., Chapter al-Fatiha) and the Glorious Qur’an.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:88: Do not even lift your eyes towards the things with which We have benefitted the disbelievers for their (few days’) luxury, nor grieve over their (turning away from the straight path), and keep your wings (of affection and care) lowered over the believers (to make them feel contented and cared for).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:89: And say: ‘Indeed, I am (now) the open and clear Warner (of Allah’s torment).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:90: The (torment) that We sent down upon the dividers (i.e., the Jews and the Christians),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:91: Those who divided the Qur’an into pieces (and split it, i.e., accepted the favourable Verses but rejected the others).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:92: So, by your Lord, We shall indeed interrogate them all,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:93: Pertaining to the works that they used to do.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:94: So declare openly all those (matters) that you have been commanded, and turn away from those who set up partners with Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:95: Surely, We suffice you for (taking them to task) who scoff,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:96: Who set up other gods along with Allah. So they will come to know (their end) soon.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:97: And We indeed know that your (sacred) breast feels straitened by what they say.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:98: So glorify your Lord with His praise and live amongst those who prostrate themselves before Him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 15:99: And worship your Lord till you attain to the station of certainty of faith (which goes with your glory, i.e., perfect cognizance of divinity or the moment of far-nearness to your Lord).

null.verse 15:1: Aliif, Laam, Raa. Nämä ovat kirjan ja selvän Koraanin säkeistöjä.
null.verse 15:2: On tuleva aika, jolloin epäuskoon antautuneet toivoisivat olevansa muslimeja.
null.verse 15:3: Anna heidän syödä ja nauttia aikansa, ja johtakoon heidän toiveensa heidät harhaan. Mutta tulevaisuudessa he kyllä sen älyävät.
null.verse 15:4: Emme ole hävittänyt ainoatakaan kaupunkia ilmoittamatta sille sen määräaikaa.
null.verse 15:5: Ei yksikään kansa voi kiirehtiä aikansa täyttymistä eikä sitä viivyttää.
null.verse 15:6: Ja he sanovat: »Voi sinua, jolle kehoitus on ylhäältä lähetetty, sinä olet selvästi houkkio.
null.verse 15:7: Miksi et tuo luoksemme enkeleitä, jos kerran puhut täyttä totta?»
null.verse 15:8: Emme Me lähetä maan päälle enkeleitä muuten kuin totuutta pystyttämään, mutta kun tämä tapahtuu, he eivät saa enää armoa.
null.verse 15:9: Totisesti, Me itse lähetämme maan päälle kehoituksen, ja Me myös seisomme sen tukena.
null.verse 15:10: Ja totisesti, jo ennen sinua Me lähetimme sananjulistajia muinaisten heimojen luokse.
null.verse 15:11: Mutta ainoatakaan lähettilästä ei saapunut heidän luoksensa, jota he eivät olisi pilkanneet.
null.verse 15:12: Näin me annamme tämän (pilkkaamisen) juurtua syntisten sydämiin.
null.verse 15:13: He eivät usko Koraaniin, ja kuitenkin heillä on tiedossa edeltäjiensä kohtalo.
null.verse 15:14: Ja jos Me avaisimme oven taivaaseen ja he kiipeäisivät sinne,
null.verse 15:15: niin he varmasti sanoisivat: »Silmämme ovat vain huienneet, tai pikemminkin me olemme lumouksen vallassa.»
